description: Conditional import fails because the imported module name doesn't match the actual filename. When APP_ENV is set to 'testing', the code tries to import from 'test_config' but the actual file is named 'testing_config.py'.
expected_fix: Change 'from .test_config import TestConfig' to 'from .testing_config import TestingConfig' in config/__init__.py
complexity_factors: Conditional import based on environment variable
Error only occurs in specific runtime conditions
Module name mismatch between import and filename
Requires understanding of environment-based configuration pattern
Need to update both import statement and variable name
